articles.title: Microsoft rolls out protection against 'reply all' email storms - Mashable
articles.description: Hopefully email storms will be a thing of the past.
articles.content: One surefire way to take down an email system is to send a message with thousands of recipients attached only to have a few of them hit reply all, generating millions more emails. Now Microsoft is introducing protection against what are commonly referred to a… [+1649 chars]

articles.author: Indo Asian News Service | Posted by Robin Sinha
articles.title: Intel-Microsoft joint project ‘STAMINA’ turns malware into images - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The researchers used an approach that they called static malware-as-image network analysis (STAMINA), Jugal Parikh and Marc Marino from Microsoft Threat Protection Intelligence Team wrote in a blog post.
articles.content:
Researchers from Intel and Microsoft have joined forces to study the use of deep learning for malware threat detection in a project that first converts malware into images.
The basis for this study is the observation that if malware samples are turned into g… [+1629 chars]
